Review Text: The northern most point of Sri Lanka. But when we are at school, our book says the northern most point is Point Pedro (Seems to be Point Pedro is the town name); So when you search the point use Sakkotai Cape in google maps; it will give you the accurate path to travel. Parking is not there, you have to park the vehicle on the road side. Sri Lankan Amy personal is doing some construction work to the place to uplift the beauty.  Nice Experience, Length of visit is 10 to 20 minutes. as of now Admission fee.

You should visit here and the lighthouse a little further along the coast road in Point Pedro. Both mark the closest point to India 32km away and the northernmost point of Sri Lanka. The guard at the navy base will usually let you go to see inside the lighthouse. You can't climb up but the tsunami reached is marked above the top of the entrance.

Review Title: Must-Visit Northern Point of Sri Lanka - Sankkotai
Review Text: Sankkotai, the northernmost point of Sri Lanka, is a place of great significance and beauty. Standing at this remote location, where the land meets the ocean, provides a unique sense of connection to the island's geography. However, visitors should be aware that there is no dedicated parking area at Sankkotai. You’ll need to park at a distance and walk to reach the point, which adds to the experience as you take in the natural surroundings. Travel Tip: The road conditions leading to Sankkotai are not ideal, so plan your visit in the morning or evening when the temperatures are cooler. Comfortable shoes are recommended for the walk. Despite the lack of facilities, the stunning views and the importance of the location make it a must-see for anyone traveling through northern Sri Lanka.

Review Title: Northernmost point of Sri Lanka, nothing more to see
Review Text: This is the northern most point in Sri Lanka. There’s a special area built to represent the unity of Sri Lanka. The beach around here is full of coral rocks and beautiful. There’s no designated parking area and you have to park beside the road.

Ever wanted to be at the top of the pearl, then invest in a ride to Sakkotei, the northernmost part of point pedro, Sri Lanka. The tip is marked by the national flag and most recently a monumental stone by the Army who made it possible for us to visit the tip of this beautiful island

A group of 18 of us visited the Sakkotai - Cape in Point Pedro on 07th July 2019.  The significance of this place is that it is the northernmost of this tear drop shaped island of Sri Lanka. The permanent signpost erected here in concrete reads "Unity in Diversity is the Strength of Sri Lanka".  All along the shoreline are boats indicating that the livelihood of people around here revolve around fishing. Other than the erected concrete signpost, there does not appear to be any other activity.
